SEC. 5. REPORTS TO CONGRESS. The Secretaries of Housing and Urban Development and Agriculture must submit joint reports to Congress on the status and outcomes of individuals given preference for housing assistance. The reports will assess the long-term success of this assistance and identify any changes needed for improvement. Information on employment and career status of these individuals will be included in the reports for a period of 10 years after the termination of assistance. The Secretaries of Housing and Urban Development and Agriculture will submit reports to Congress on individuals receiving housing assistance, including details on employment, housing, education, well-being, criminal justice interactions, marital status, and other relevant information. Reports will contain aggregate outcomes without personally identifiable information and will be submitted within 10 years. The Secretaries of Housing and Urban Development and Agriculture will submit reports to Congress on individuals receiving housing assistance, including details on various aspects of their lives. Reports will be submitted every 5 years starting from the enactment of this Act.
